Row.Text: Crowds gather in your city's marketplace, voices from many different lands ringing out as deals are struck and bargains made. Some are angry about this, and believe that foreigners will destroy our trade. Others, however, encourage the foreign business, hoping to learn from their culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How do you feel about this? Choose from the following options:
Let the foreigners continue to trade.
Implement heavy taxes on imported goods.

Monuments represent the most important symbols of your culture. Your people seek to celebrate this by dedicating the City's Monument to either their ancestors, or to their gods.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How do you feel about this? Choose from the following options:
Dedicate the Monument to our ancestors.
The gods are what is important now.
Neither will suffice. The Monument should generate revenue.
